alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Lafayette; Nevada; Union (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 06 at 3:08PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of south central Arkansas and southwest Arkansas, including the following counties, in south central Arkansas, Union. In southwest Arkansas, Columbia, Lafayette and Nevada. * WHEN...Until 430 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 307 PM CDT, The public has reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms with water over some roadways near Magnolia, AR. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... El Dorado, Magnolia, Smackover, Waldo, Norphlet, McNeil, Strong, Calion, Lisbon, Wesson, Mount Holly, Village, Lawson, Urbana, Macedonia, Lapile, Calhoun, Cairo, Newell and Three Creeks. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
